title: Chord: sus4 in A# (Shape: A)
content:
## Chord: A# (A-shape) suspended 4th

The A# (A-shape) sus4 chord is a variation of the A# major chord, featuring an added 4th note. This chord is built using the open A major chord shape, with the pinky finger on the 3rd string one fret higher than the 2nd finger. The resulting sound has a tension-filled quality, creating a sense of anticipation that can resolve back to the major chord or another harmony.

### Notes and Intervals:
- Root: A#
- 3rd: E#
- 4th: D#
- 5th: F#
- Octave: A#

This chord includes the root note A#, the major 3rd E#, the perfect 4th D#, and the perfect 5th F#.

### Genre and Musical Flavor:
The A# (A-shape) sus4 chord is commonly used in various genres to create tension and add color to chord progressions. It is often heard in alternative rock, pop, and folk music, where it can evoke emotions ranging from melancholy to a sense of longing or mystery. This chord adds a unique texture to a song and can serve as a transitional element leading to a resolution.

### Example Songs:
1. **"Stairway to Heaven" by Led Zeppelin**: The iconic acoustic intro of this classic rock masterpiece features an A# (A-shape) sus4 chord progression, contributing to the ethereal and epic quality of the song.
   
2. **"Wonderwall" by Oasis**: This popular Britpop anthem uses the A# (A-shape) sus4 chord in the intro and throughout the song, enhancing the bittersweet and nostalgic atmosphere of the track.

3. **"Fast Car" by Tracy Chapman**: In this folk-pop ballad, the A# (A-shape) sus4 chord adds depth and emotional resonance to the heartfelt storytelling within the song.
